DOC.brief_title: Mindfulness Meditation Survivorship Education Improving Behavioral Symptoms Younger Stage 0-III Breast Cancer Survivors ( Pathways Wellness )
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To evaluate efficacy two different type group intervention ( mindfulness survivorship education ) , specifically tailor need young female breast cancer survivor , reduce depressive symptom , compare usual care control group . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To compare efficacy two intervention relative usual care control group fatigue , sleep disturbance , vasomotor symptom . II . To examine efficacy two intervention relative usual care control group circulate genomic marker inflammation . III . To explore potential moderator mediator intervention efficacy two intervention group . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 3 arm . ARM A ( MINDFULNESS AWARENESS PRACTICES [ MAPs ] ) : Patients attend mindfulness meditation class 2 hour weekly 6 week . Patients attend person booster session include guided meditation , question , discussion maintain mindfulness practice 1 hour monthly 3 month . ARM B ( SURVIVORSHIP EDUCATION INTERVENTION [ SE ] ) : Patients attend survivorship education class 2 hour weekly 6 week . Patients also receive monthly electronic newsletter tailor information topic interest young survivor , include cancer-related event community tip follow recommendation healthy living . ARM C ( USUAL CARE/DELAYED TREATMENT CONTROL GROUP ) : Patients receive usual care 9 month . Patients offer choice participate Arm A Arm B . After completion study , patient follow 3 6 month .
